text.0: o uṣas strong with strength endowed witli knowledge accept the singers praise o wealthy lady.
text.1: thou goddess ancient young and full of wisdom movest allbounteous as the law ordaineth.
text.2: shine forth o morning thou auspicious goddess on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices.
text.3: let docile horses of farreaching splendour convey thee hitherward the goldencoloured.
text.4: thou morning turning thee to every creature standest on high as ensign of the immortal.
text.5: to one same goal ever and ever wending now like a wheel o newlyborn roll hi ther.
text.6: letting her reins drop downward morning cometh the wealthy dame the lady of the dwelling.
text.7: bringing forth light the wonderful the blessed hath spread her from the bounds of earth and heaven.
text.8: hither invoke the radiant goddess morning and bring with reverence your hymn to praise her.
text.9: she dropping sweets hath set in heaven her brightness and fair to look on hath beamed forth her splendour.
text.10: from heaven with hymns the holy one was wakened brightly to both worlds came the wealthy lady.
text.11: to morning agni when she comes refulgent thou goest forth soliciting fair riches.
text.12: on laws firm base the speeder of the mornings the bull hath entered mighty earth and heaven.
text.13: great is the power of varuṇa and mitra which bright hath spread in every place its splendour.
